perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in Schedule C to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on Schedule C.
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage shall purchase some ingredients and packaging materials to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through billing processes.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to 'Schedule C' and 'the [***] billing as identified on Schedule C' in Section 3(b), while Schedule C is referenced elsewhere, this omission creates uncertainty regarding which materials Heritage must purchase and what billing process to use. If another section defines specific billing details tied to Schedule C, this change contradicts that.

perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall charge Premier [***] as set forth in Schedule C.
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage shall charge Premier certain amounts.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to 'Schedule C' in Section 3(c), while Schedule C is referenced elsewhere, this creates uncertainty regarding the charges. If another section states the fees will be the one defined by Schedule C, this is a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered to Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A, which Schedule may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the “Specifications”), shall conform to Post Holding’s Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and shall conform in all material respects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage.
perturbation.changed_text: All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered to Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier (the “Specifications”), and shall conform in all material respects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to 'Schedule A' and 'Schedule E' in Section 2(h), while Schedule A and E are referenced elsewhere, and its explicit requirement of manufactured product to conform to both Schedule A and Schedule E, this omission creates uncertainty regarding which material specifications the product needs to conform to. If another section states the produced product also need to conform with 'Schedule A' or 'Schedule E', this creates a contradiction.
